thread.title: Man named Santa Claus to join City Council in North Pole, Alaska
thread.title_full: Man named Santa Claus to join City Council in North Pole, Alaska | www.ajc.com

author: Cox Media Group National Content Desk
title: Man named Santa Claus to join City Council in North Pole, Alaska
text:
Santa Claus is now officially representing North Pole – but it’s not what you think.
According to Fairbanks Daily New-Miner , a man whose legal name is Santa Claus received 58 votes in the 2,200-person city of North Pole, Alaska in a write-in campaign for an open City Council seat. Claus launched the campaign when no candidates had officially filed for the two open council seats.
>> Read more trending stories
Claus, who started campaigning just two weeks before the Tuesday election, will join the six-member City Council.
The second seat went to Elyse Dawson, a youth pastor in North Pole that began a write-in campaign less than two weeks before the Oct. 6 election.
“I think Santa Claus and Elyse Dawson will be great,” said North Pole City Clerk Kathy Weber.
Claus, who legally changed his name from Thomas Patrick O’Connor, is the former president of the North Pole Chamber of Commerce.
KTUU reports Claus paraded around in a red velvet suit during his campaign.
"I'm sure glad Santa won," News-Miner reported one person said. Wayne C. Grieme, Frontier Foto NORTH POLE, ALASKA: This North Pole, population 2,200, is 12 miles from Fairbanks; it was officially named in 1953. The Santa Claus House includes a gift shop, Santa and real reindeer. "Every year we receive thousands of letters to Santa from kids all over the world," said manager Paul Brown.
